N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9650.6 - Procedures for appeals

State Regulations
(a) The
executive director shall be designated as appeals officer to hear appeals from
denials of requests by a records access officer. (b) When a request for inspection has been
denied in writing in whole or in part by a records access officer, the
requesting party shall have 30 days after receipt of the denial within which to
appeal. An appeal shall be in writing, addressed to the appeals officer, and
shall include the name of the records access officer who denied the request, the date of the request, the date or the denial, the records which were the
subject of the request and the name and address of the appellant. (c) Each appeals officer shall transmit to
the Committee on Open Government, Department of State, 162 Washington Avenue, Albany, NY 12231, copies of all appeals upon their receipt. (d) Within 10 business days from the date of
actual receipt of an appeal, the appeals officer shall make a written
determination either affirming or reversing the denial and shall transmit
copies of the determination to the appellant and the Committee on Open

Government. A determination affirming a denial shall state the grounds for
withholding the requested records and that judicial review of the denial may be
obtained in a proceeding under article 78 of the Civil Practice Law and Rules
commenced within four months after determination of the
appeal. Notes
